body:
This issue isn't strictly a bug, so it didn't seem to make sense to use one of the existing templates.

[Line 162 of the `llvm` package in commit 75042c381c9fd1412f0fce99aab9ebd43fd528c8 (current `HEAD` of `develop` as of this writing)](https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/8b515f3ba07d6a67e8a75c506a2d5d4816a73fa6/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/llvm/package.py#L162) mentions a nonexistent `+clang_extra` flag in a `conflicts` directive, i.e.:

```python
conflicts("+clang_extra", when="~clang")
```
title: llvm package includes conflict directive with nonexistent flag
